text.p: Latvia's wood-processing sector registered a 125 percent turnover increase to 69.027 million lats in 1996 against the previous year, Diena Bizness newspaper reported on Thursday.

The 24 companies united in the Association of Latvian Timber Producers last year processed one million cubic metres of timber, Andris Plezers, manager of the association, was quoted by the newspaper as saying.
The Latvijas finieris plywood producer registered 1996 turnover of 33.7 million lats, an increase of 8.34 million lats or 32 percent, the biggest in sector.
Nine out of 24 companies registered in the association showed a 1996 profit while 15 were in the red.
Western clients are the main ones today against five years ago when some 97 percent went to the former Soviet Union.
